agenda.description: ** REVISION ** HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: County Affairs TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 25, 2019 PLACE: E2.028 CHAIR: Rep. Garnet Coleman The committee will meet to hear pending business and hear public testimony on the following bills: HB 135 White Relating to regulation of working animals by counties and municipalities. HB 356 Lang Relating to the repeal of a statute allowing the county attorney or commissioners court of Brown County to accept gifts or grants to finance or assist the operation of the office of county attorney. HB 815 Kuempel Relating to the authority of a county to require photo identification to file certain documents with the county clerk. HB 1356 Button | et al. Relating to the requirements for meetings of certain special districts. HB 1733 Zedler Relating to advertising or other information regarding licensed bail bond sureties posted in secure correctional facilities. HB 2575 Martinez Relating to the duty of a county to refund an amount of $5 or less paid to the county clerk. HB 3105 Burns Relating to the authority of a county to restrict sex offenders from child safety zones in the unincorporated area of the county. HB 3270 Miller Relating to the discharge of a prisoner from a county jail. HB 4073 Perez Relating to the time for dissolution of a crime control and prevention district. HB 4248 Kuempel Relating to specifications for legal papers filed with a county clerk. HB 4337 Bohac Relating to positions designated as exempt from sheriff's department civil service systems in certain counties. HB 4736 Israel Relating to the annual salary paid to judges of county courts at law in Travis County. HB 4748 Dutton Relating to the authority of the Near Northside Management District to impose a sales and use tax. HB 4752 Dutton Relating to the territory of the Barrett Management District. Notice of this meeting was announced from the house floor. ** See Committee Coordinator for previous versions ** of the schedule, if applicable. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
